ai.summary: A short, easy 2.9 km circular walk in the UK. Millennium Way Circular Walk 16 is suitable for most ages and fitness levels, offering a gentle route that returns to the starting point without significant climbs.
ai.terrain_summary: Primarily flat with gentle gradients. The route uses a mix of well-trodden paths, grassy verges, and compact surfaces. Surface conditions can be uneven after rain, and there may be gates or small steps along the way. Some sections could pass near busy roads.
ai.safety_notes: Always check the weather before you go. Wear sturdy footwear and bring a waterproof layer. Stay on marked paths, observe gate and stile etiquette, and be mindful of road crossings. Keep children and dogs under control, and carry a small first-aid kit and water. Be aware that mobile signal can be limited in rural sections.
recommended_gear: Sturdy walking shoes or lightweight hiking boots
Map or offline navigation on your phone
ai.best_seasons: All year round, with extra care in winter and after heavy rain.
